availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles M. Humston (Henry County sheriff and farmer)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, sheriff and farmer. Virginia native. Married to Susan Humston. Father of George Humston, Milton Humston, Thomas Humston, Lucy Humston, Ludlow Humston, Charles Humston, Oscar Humston, Susan B. Humston, and Orlester Humston. Farmer in Henry County in 1850 and 1860. Sheriff of Henry County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 378A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 263.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 179.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Port Royal, p. 369B.
“An Act for the Benefit of C. M. Humston, Sheriff of Henry County,” Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Passed at the Session Which was Begun and Held in the City of Frankfort on Monday, The Fifth Day of December, 1859, and ended on Monday, the Fifth Day of March, 1860 vol. 2 (Frankfort: Yeoman Office, 1860), 847.
Find A Grave, "Charles Morehead Humston," Memorial # 65710180, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65710180 (accessed December 11, 2018).
